data.title: Kevin Campbell, former Everton and Arsenal forward, dies aged 54
data.meta_description: No Englishman scored more Premier League goals without winning a cap than Campbell, a title winner in north London and Everton’s first black captain
data.text:
When Kevin Campbell came through at Arsenal in the late 1980s, the apprentices cleaned the manager’s car, tidied the marble corridors and shovelled snow from the North Bank at Highbury.

It proved to be a solid grounding for Campbell, who has died at the age of 54. He was a prolific scorer in the club’s academy, once managing 59 goals in a single season, before making his first-team debut, aged 18, in 1988. He won four trophies with Arsenal — the league title in 1990-91, the League Cup and FA Cup in 1993, and European Cup Winners’ Cup in 1994, scoring 55 goals in 209 matches.

Raised in Brixton, south London, in a family of five boys and five girls, he went to the same
